text: Royal Castle onto the Śląsko-Dąbrowski Bridge of the route The inauguration of the Route, July 22, 1949 The Warsaw W-Z Route (, East-West Route) is a major thoroughfare in Warsaw, Poland, that joins Praga in the east with the city center, going through Muranów and out to Wola in the west. It was one of the first major post-World War II infrastructure projects, carried out during 1947-1949."How Warsaw Came Close to Never Being Rebuilt" ==References== Category:1949 establishments in Poland Category:Fast traffic roads in Warsaw
title: Warsaw W-Z Route
